review.author: Cheria C.
review.description: Fantastic school. Beautiful campus, supportive teachers, and great band/sports programs.

name: South Central Community Unit School District 401

review.author: Grace P.
review.description: Out of all the schools my daughter has gone to she and I both love it. Everyone there is nice and no one steels you don't even have to put a lock on her locker. It is a great learning environment for all ages. They are building a new gym lunch room and more, I feel as this is a wonderful thing that they have needed to do. I really is a higher degree of learning.

review.author: Colton F.
review.description: I can't say enough about my amazing school! As a result of my education and ministry training, I am getting to live out my dream of being a Next Generation Pastor! My professors were so well educated and excellent leaders. If you're searching for a place to call home while learning what the call of God looks like on your life, you've found the right place! Welcome Home! HC Family! Until The End!

review.author: Alexandra G.
review.description: Mark and Karen are great people! Mark is a great instructor and thanks to him I passed my final. His class was fun and instructive. I am looking forward to taking my state exam and passing.

review.author: Janet A.
review.description: If you love Trump, have hatred for ex wives or like for someone to read a text book to you, Yarborough may be your man.  Otherwise I suggest you take an online course.

review.author: Vu H.
review.description: This class offered excellent lessons and informations if you really want to become a real estate agent.  The instructor is very knowledgable and know how to convey that knowledge to his students. This school setting environment sure beats any online classes.

review.author: Kelsey T.
review.description: Fabulous school. From teachers to facility, everything is so great! I would highly recommend Creative Montessori School to anyone with children in the Birmingham area.

review.author: Mayumi M.
review.description: My daughter goes to pre-school here.  I absolutely love how she has transformed from a shy child to an outgoing, social butterfly.  The teachers are wonderful and care about each child's growth.  The children learn French when they are in preschool.  I love how my daughter says everyday "do you know how to say ... in French?" It's just a wonderful environment where every child can learn on his/her pace.  Every child is encouraged to think for themselves and I believe they will all become leaders! Thank you CMS for shaping my daughter into the wonderful person she is today!

review.author: Brittani V.
review.description: While I am unable to speak to the quality of the education they provide, I wanted to share my feedback with other parents regarding the admissions process. I contacted the school in late October to arrange a tour to obtain more information. We are considering a number of private schools for our son and Creative Montessori was simply one option. In response to my request, I was told the first tour available was February. That's right ...4 months just to obtain a tour. I thought I had misunderstood the email so I called them. Lisa confirmed that this was indeed the first tour because they are so busy with tours. If it takes 4 months just to visit as a prospective attendee, I can't help but wonder how long it would take to get a parent/ teacher meeting if my son actually attended!! There are far too many other fantastic private schools in the area to consider.

review.author: Jessica P.
review.description: We have two children at CMS and one who graduated from 6th grade last year and went on to a conventional learning environment. So now I have something to compare the experience. I can say, without a doubt, CMS offers an environment that cultivates intellectual curiosity. My children love to learn because of this school.

review.author: Pam W.
review.description: We enrolled my daughter in CMS as she entered second grade and she did not leave until she graduated in the sixth grade.  During those years she learned to love learning, she became very independent and driven.  In addition to getting a sound academic background, she learned to understand and appreciate people from all walks of life.  Character education is a huge part of the program at CMS and the values learned are applied to all areas of life.  My daughter has become a happy and successful adult who continues to seek knowledge and has a tremendous love of and respect for all people.  I attribute these things to her education at Creative and to the teachers who nurtured her along the way!

review.author: Heather K.
review.description: My daughter attended this school in the past, and since has moved on to a much better school experience. The teachers were not sure how to handle the learning style of my child. Instead of meeting with me to address the issue of educating her, the staff kind of ignored her problems. When she left to go to another school, her teacher was shocked by how far behind my daughter had fallen compared to her fellow class mates.

review.author: Rashmee S.
review.description: We very much appreciate MKU. When we were looking for childcare and early education options for our son, we knew MKU was our choice school upon witnessing first hand the method, the facilities, the teachers, and the diversity of the student body. As American Muslims raised in Alabama, navigating the intersectionality of our various identities was often challenging, and upon becoming parents, we wanted to ensure our son would be cared for in an environment that embraces each individual child and their unique attributes. The staff here is highly professional and caring. The facilities are clean and uncluttered. I'm continually impressed by the activities that our now 14 month old partakes in: various fruit tastings, artwork, Spanish lessons, circle time, etc...So far, despite the expense (comparable to similar facilities in the area) we are so happy with our choice and eagerly look forward to our son's continued growth and development at this school/daycare.

review.author: Will B.
review.description:
Such a fantastic locally owned business. I have had the pleasure of coming in here on a few occasions for various reasons. The first time I came here was to help my grandmother get supplies to make a christening gown for my daughter. The people in here are so friendly and helpful and produce some amazing looking items.

My wife and I were gifted a smocking class by family and gave us a different experience with them than what you normally have with a retail store. And yes, I did take a smocking class... and it was a blast! The teacher really helped us learned the strategies and was great about it when we made mistakes (which is bound to happen). It was a fun experience that we have not utilized the benefits of to its fullest potential.

Anything else we have needed, the staff here has given great assistance. Any time we need fabric or have questions, the Smocking Bird is our go-to place to visit.

review.author: Randy S.
review.description: OK I am biased, I am attending the school.  They have been teaching law since 1915.  Designed to allow people with established careers to extend their knowledge or change career.  It is a most welcome option for me.  Instructors all practice in their areas of instruction, unlike regular law schools where the professors can not practice and teach the standard from the books.

review.author: Steve L.
review.description:
So five years later, all three kids making straight A's in math.  My oldest daughter wants to do advanced math with her twin brother.  She asks to return back to Mathnasium.  We have all three  go.   My youngest daughter was super strong in all areas except two.  

My oldest son is doing algebra I in 8th grade.  He was strong in most areas with a few missing.  Both older kids struggled on some parts of the assessment because they were not allowed to use calculators.  

Apparently, they both make straight A's in middle school because they know how to use a calculator.  Thirty days later attending 3 days a week and oldest son and youngest daughters are great with masteries on weak areas. My oldest daughter is going 4-5 days a week to get ready for Algebra I after taking no pre-Algebra classes.

I ask my kids how is it?  All of them say...Mathnasium teaches math in such a way that makes it easier and faster to learn.

I am a huge fan of this place because I have seen how they took two young kids confused by common core (youngest does not have it) and turn them into A students and confident in math.  This summer will hopefully give all three a strong foundation to continue as they prepare for high school!

review.author: James N.
review.description: These guys are VERY good at what they do. Daughter was in an accelerated math class, when she missed several days of school. Upon returning, she was hopelessly behind. Thinking she had an understanding, she proceeded to take and fail the next two exams. Mathnasium turned things around. She caught up and, after managing a C for that grade period, she got an A in her subsequent period. Thanks again to Mathnasium.

review.author: Sue W.
review.description: This place is one of the best math tutoring places I've been to, and I have been to a lot. Excellent tutors, great communication and reasonably priced.  I can't recommend A+ high enough.

review.author: Catherine F.
review.description: I have recommended Mathnasium to many friends and family, as well as on social media. The owner and her staff are top notch. They get to know each student personally and go above and beyond to help them succeed. As a parent, my stress level greatly decreased after my child started going to Mathnasium. They helped my child when I couldn't. The flexibility of mathnasium cannot be beat for busy families.

name: South Central Community Unit School Dist 501
Hayden Middle School Child Nutrition Program

review.author: Nikki T.
review.description: Nice building, nice people.  Both my sons attend AHS.  The Teachers are responsive and helpful.  The JROTC program is amazing, very active in the community.

review.author: Dustin L.
review.description: I normally don't leave reviews unless it's something exceptional. In this case, it is exceptionally bad. This is the third college I've been to and by far the worst. The biggest reason I am leaving such an awful review is the fact that the financial aid office has refused to process my fafsa unless my parents commit tax fraud. They were separate at the time but the school wants them to refile as married not separate. I also owe the school a bit of money since scholarships didn't cover enough and fafsa wasn't processed so I had to solely rely on that. So I got a loan but I was told it wouldn't be active until the first day of classes. That means yet again my attempt to relieve the hold and register for classes was a bust. Next up is the food, the cafeteria seems to constantly under cook food. More specifically the chicken is almost always raw. And third is the teachers, but most specifically an english teacher named Mrs. Carter. Who gave me numerous zeros for assignments I turned in without any explanation why causing me to go from a B to an F in the last few weeks of classes. All in all I do not recommend attending this university.

name: Hayden High School Athletics Field House

review.author: Gino Y.
review.description: Best school ever $$$$$ \nR.I.P Bill Dixon   we all remember you and your lovely wife Snookie Dixon best peoples ever

review.author: Chris C.
review.description: The best college that I have ever attended!!! I would totally recommend Ouachita to anyone that needs to be smarter, but if you want to be smarter be sure that you have enough money to be smart

review.author: Miami S.
review.description: When we heard Sarah Huckabee gradutated from OBU we became very interested. Always curious to ascertain calibre of graduates, learned a lot.

review.author: Susan S.
review.description: Great staff dedicated to district support and student success!

name: Ingram J F State Technical College-Special Ed

review.author: Niekia T.
review.description: We're here today visiting Huntingdon College In Montgomery, AL with my stepson. He's a potential recruit for Football. I'm not sure in what direction he will go as far as choosing a college, but so far I like it. Although Huntingdon is not an HBCU, I would definitely look into attending this college. We were able to take pictures in the weight room, and me and the boys got a chance to enjoy the beautiful campus they have. It wasn't that far from Birmingham, and the staff really seem to care about their students not "Just" as football players, but as individuals and their success in the classrooms. Overall, this seems to be a really good college, and even though, once again, its not an HBCU, I will fully support this school.

review.author: Rhea P.
review.description:
I have never attended, but I love walking the lovely grounds and the viewing the architecture.

The library is so very special to me.  Very cozy with a lot of character. 

According to Legend, two red lady ghosts inhabited Pratt Hall dormitory.

review.author: Jim C.
review.description: Three of my children went to Huntingdon College. My youngest Josh will finish Florida State University Medical School in May. My youngest daughter Mary went on to make top grades at Boston University School of Law and the Federal Court of Appeals in Atlanta. My oldest daughter choose to be a full time mother. Her daughter is now on full scholarship at Troy University. A Huntingdon College education for my children was just what they needed. \n\nThe campus is beautiful, the classes small, the culture helpful, and the faculty excellent. After graduation each of my children have remained in contact with their college professors who have been supportive long after graduation. Visit and see what  you think. It was great for our family and I give it top marks.

review.author: Tammy H.
review.description: My son was going to a private school and making pretty decent grades. After receiving his SAT results I noticed that he was only reading on a third grade level and he was is eighth grade. I contacted MasterRead on Zelda Road and I so glad we did. The price was reasonable and he received one on one tutoring. In a short period of time he went from reading on a third grade level to reading on a ninth grade level and his grades sired. He went from a C average student to an A-B average student! \n\nMs Walker is absolutely amazing!

review.author: Kathy C.
review.description: A must see! The displays and videos were amazing. I learned so much & wish everyone could go here. First class museum!

review.author: Tank G.
review.description:
This Museum is located across from the Troy campus. It is co-located with a library that is only accesible to Troy students. They have metered street parking right out front and within a reasonable walking distance.

The site of the museum is significant because it is where Rosa Parks was arrested on a bus for not giving up her seat. It has a historical marker out front marking the location. It has a neat sculpture outside that can only be viewed directly, any other angles and you are looking at some posts in the group.  There is also a very nice sculpture of Ms. Parks sitting alone in her seat on the bus. It makes for great photos.

The museum is small and offers self guided tours. There are no pictures allowed in the main exhibit area. The tour begins in a small room with benches around it. You watch a movie about segregation in Montgomery, the bus system and the boycott. Once the movie is over, some doors open and leads you to the next area. The next area is a pretty neat reenactment of Rosa Parks being arrested on the bus. You view the action as if you are viewing it from outside of the bus. It is very nice and really makes you feel like you are in the action. 

 After the reenactment on the bus, some doors open up to a gallery that has exhibits, videos, artifacts, and pictures. You move at your own pace from this spot until the end of the tour. You will see a replica carpool vehicle over there, you will also hear stories told by people that were there during that time via videos and you will see a display of leaders riding the bus after the boycott ended. They give you the option of using your phone for an audio tour in a few sections of the museum. It provides you some information about what you are looking at. I did not use it because it seemed like more effort than what it was worth to me. Some type of push button audio kiosk would be perfect in its place. Anyway, as i mentioned, the exhibit area is not a very big area. We went through it in about 15 minutes.. The entire tour took us about 30 minutes. Even though thee is not a lot to it, it was still a nice visit and I  learned a bit. It does a good job making you feel as if you are back during that time.

No museum would be complete without a gift shop, this one is no exception. They have a small gift shop where you not only purchase you museum admission, but you can buy souvenirs like shirts or bags.

All-in-all this a decent museum. I love that it is located on the historical site where the bus incident occurred. It is small, but still makes a great impact. It' is definitely worth a visit if you are in downtown Montgomery. I would recommend checking out some of the other nearby museums, like the Legacy Museum and Civil Rights Center to maximize your trip.

review.author: Penny S.
review.description:
This museum is two parts - our family of five just did the museum experience. We had to wait for it to be go in as there are timed small experiences for the first part. This was really just an intro to welcome to the museum. 

We spent probably 1.5 hours here without doing the second portion. The last half of the museum has lots of reading, but the first part was a great simulation experience that even the youngest would get a deeper understanding of Rosa. The museum store could be improved as there are so many amazing kid books about Rosa Parks.

The library next door was mentioned as something to do - but they said this was only for school groups. Don't forget to walk several blocks to see the Rosa Parks statue at the fountain.

This is well worth the entrance fee!

review.author: Carrie G.
review.description: The coolest thing is that this is on site of where Rosa parks bus stop was! In the museum I loved that we could watch the situation as a pedestrian looking into the bus. I love museum that's make things as real as possible! We really learned a lot here!

review.author: Endora B.
review.description: Always nice to know your history. If it had not been for her not giving up her seat on the bus no telling where we would be

review.author: Becky D.
review.description: I took my 8 yr old here to tour the Rosa Parks exhibit. The exhibit was educational & engaging. The staff at the library were also helpful including Marilyn, one of the custodians.

review.author: Richard R.
review.description:
Meet Mr. Rivets, the robotic operator of a time machine bus that looks very similar to the buses used by the City of Montgomery during the bus boycott of 1955-56.

    __V__
   |  ~  ~  |
   |   o o  |        Hi!!!
 {    [---]   }
   |______|

You will find him in the Children's Annex of the Rosa Parks museum which features a historic time-jump to different dates using large screens on either side of the time machine and prerecorded narrating. On the second floor is a photo timeline of Civil Rights events and informational columns highlighting the important faces of the movement and their story.

Back in the main building is a gift shop, exhibition art hall and a self guided tour highlighting the famous story of Rosa Louise McCauley Parks and her defiance to give up her seat on that faithful day. What I never knew about the history of this event was that it wasn't altogether random. Rosa Parks planned to do this with the help of other civil rights leaders so they could use it as a launching point for a federal case against the unconstitutional segregation laws in Alabama. It was only an idea, but Rosa fulfilled it when she found the opportunity, because it couldn't be staged. That takes nothing away from Rosa Parks. The danger of such defiance was deadly real, as witnessed by the Freedom Riders in the same era.

Oddly, the case was not brought to court using Rosa. Instead they used the first person to actually defy the bus laws, young Claudette Colvin, whom was 15 and pregnant at the age of her arrest. Her arrest happened on March 2nd, 1955, a full 9 months before Rosa's arrest on December 1, 1955.

The story is told using a full sized model of a Montgomery bus as you stand outside of the bus looking through the windows (which utilize TV screens). The bus is set in a room that looks like a small movie set with buildings, a faux street and streetlights. Here is a link to a Youtube video of this exhibit: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h82ajl69iy0

OVERALL it is a great experience, especially when coupled with the other Civil Rights museums in the downtown area. Not far away from the RP Library the City of Montgomery is working to construct a park and monument @ the site of the famous bus stop where Rosa boarded. Not sure when it will be ready as digging was underway during our May 2019 visit. The Library is actually the location of the arrest. Both the Time Machine exhibit in the Children's Annex and the Bus Arrest exhibit in the main building are must see's when visiting Montgomery Alabama and the Freedom Trail. Come see the quiet unspoken life's work of a Civil Rights pioneer.


2019/82

review.author: Ben E.
review.description: This place is really good. It was engaging, emotional, and it left me feeling so optimistic about our ability to make a positive impact. I recommend it for everyone. Another thing I liked, it's much more immersive than most museums. Def recommend.

review.author: Pumpkin C.
review.description: Another great museum to visit while you're in Montgomery. I decided to take my family, luckily it wasn't packed during that time, which gave us the freedom to take our time to reflect while reading and listening to the host. They do not allow you to sit on the bus, however just to be there was an experience.

review.author: Julio H.
review.description:
Such a historical figure... 

This museum is a very fun museum. Your visit starts with a brief video, only to be followed by an interactive exhibit. It is one of the coolest things I remember at a museum. It really charges you emotionally and creates an interest. After the initial exposition, you follow into another room where you free flow and explore at will. If you are not familiar at all with the Civil Rights movement, well, there are lots of reading to do on these displays.

This is one of the better exhibits I have been to, and I truly think they should make it a traveling exhibit.

review.author: Paisley T.
review.description:
Well, 2 out of 2 exhibits were 'out of order' and so I didn't get to see the museum like normal. But still. 

I guess the bus time machine would be cool for grade school kiddos. I mean, the video was informative and all but the shaky bus was just a goofy distraction for me as an adult. And since the Rosa Parks hologram wasn't working I cannot comment on the most critical piece of the museum: The actual part about Rosa and the boycott. Oh well. 

On the other side, the room opened up but they had to turn the lights on in order to see the graphics and pictures. I basically just walked through and read the placards. Towards the back, when you walk through the larger exhibit pieces and follow the boycott timeline that's where it gets cool. They did a good job with the last section of your visit. 

Customer service was great at the front desk. But in the gift shop where you buy your tickets I felt like the lady was irritated that I bothered her with a question.

review.author: Katherine C.
review.description: The introduction is excellent.  The initial film to the actual bus and the interactive film of her arrest is a treat to watch.  Its $7.50 for this half of history.  The artwork and artifacts are excellent.  There was free parking in the lot opposite corner of the museum.   Although the metered parking was plentiful and cheap.  Coins only though.  The museum took about an hour at a leisurely pace.

review.author: Alexis B.
review.description: Great little museum on the site where Rosa parks was arrested for refusing to give her seat up to a white man on a city bus in 1955. There's a short video about segregation in busing in Montgomery and then a short video which depicts the way the arrest occurred. And then there are a couple of small rooms containing artifacts relating to her arrest and the subsequent successful Montgomery Bus Boycott, including the original fingerprint arrest record of Mrs. Park as well as other court documents and police records. (There is also a small gallery which, when I visited in April 2018, had some very powerful art by V. L. Cox.) The museum is a little on the small side, but well worth a visit if you want to learn more about Rosa Parks and the Montgomery Bus Boycott in the place where that history occurred!

review.author: Loren M.
review.description:
As an educator I jump at the chance to learn about historical events so while in town visiting family I knew I had to stop at the museum. 
My first impression was that the staff was not very warm or welcoming. The tone of the 4 people that I encountered was not very helpful or patient. 
Once we got our tickets we went to the Children's Museum which consisted of a big noisy "bus ride" that played a video that took the rider through history up until the Rosa Parks incident. I found this part very overwhelming even as an adult. 
Back at the museum we watched another short film and then went into a room to watch a video reenactment of the night Rosa Parks was arrested. 
The museum has other paintings, photos, memorabilia, and artifacts that take you through the civil rights movement. 
I would say this is a "must do" while in town.

review.author: Michelle J.
review.description: Beautiful museum that honors a civil rights pioneer. The staff is amazing. I didn't have a lot of time but they have a gallery, in case you don't have time for the museum. There are two parts to the museum so you should leave about two hours. When I return I will probably take the time to really take it in. I didn't count on there being so much to see in Montgomery.

review.author: Iman S.
review.description:
Had a wonderful visit to the Rosa Parks Museum. I didn't realize that the children's wing and main museum were two separate things. This is probably why the first time we tried going, we thought it was closed but it said it was open. But it's because we were at the children's wing entrance. So be mindful of that. Just walk up the sidewalk and the Museum and Library entrance are right there. 

Decided to take my 7yr old, because it was the day of the midterm elections and she's doing a report on Rosa Parks for school. 

She said it Mae her feel a little creeped out. I asked her "why?", because we had also gone to the EJI's Lynching Memorial and she didn't find that disturbing at all. Apparently for her the photos and videos at the Museum make it more real for her. But she did retain a lot of the information about Rosa and the boycott. 

I'm going to ask if her school will take the kids to the children's wing next year. 

The staff is friendly and very helpful. Enjoyed ourselves

review.author: Jon C.
review.description:
"This is so creepy. Hurry up" is the text that I got from my friend while making a slight detour and hitting the restroom instead of walking into the "time machine" immediately after paying $28 for two adults do to both the Children's Time Machine piece as well as the museum.  

When I walked through the doors, I saw what he was talking about. Inside a big room sat an over-sized replica of a bus surrounded by used computer parts and lights that were intended to make the place look like you were traveling back in time. I don't know if I would have called it creepy - but with him being the only person in the room, I can see why he wanted me to hurry up and get there so they could start. That's right.. it was just the two of us along for the trip through time.

The feature started and Mr. Rivetts, our "bus driver" (which looked like the robot from the movie Short Circuit) took us on a trip through time starting in Cincinnati meeting a young boy named Jim Crow and ended up in the 1950's after being introduced to Mrs Parks. While definitely geared towards children, it was worthwhile to go through. There were TV's throughout the entire room and the walls became projection screens, so even if the room was packed with students on a field trip, everyone would be able to see.

After going through the Children's part, our admission also got us into the 1955 and beyond part of the exhibit. A much smaller room was waiting on us with very few seats, but we sat down and watched interviews on three projectors and learned more about Rosa Parks specifically. After about 15 minutes of watching this, the automatic doors opened and we were outside on a street corner in 1955 watching and listening on the city bus when Rosa Parks refused to give up her seat. 

The rest of the tour was a self-guided walking tour of the bus boycott, church meetings, police reports and historic memorabilia. As I walked through the museum, I thought to myself many times "I can't believe this happened only 50 years ago!" 

Learning about this in the history books is one thing.. walking the streets of Montgomery and seeing it unfold on a likelike tour is something completely different. I'll always remember this trip and be thankful that I was able to do it.

review.author: Dee H.
review.description:
Troy University oversees the Rosa Parks Library and Museum.  After a trip to the Civil Rights Museum, we stopped by here.  Without a doubt, the Rosa Parks tour features the most interactive and engaging setup that I have ever seen.  After passing the ticket gate, visitors are invited to watch an opening video on a three-panel television display mounted high above.  Given that we were a large group, seating was insufficient, but we didn't seem to take issue with plopping down on the floor.  In retrospect, it gave the video a drive-in sort of feel.

The next stop was an audiovisual tour of the Montgomery bus boycott.  A facsimile of the bus appeared against a wall.  Audio recordings simulated Ms. Park's refusal to vacate her seat; though Rosa's voice actor's speech was a bit slow, I appreciated the accompanying voices' authenticity until the moment of her arrest.  This part of the museum was very dark, so I would urge visitors to be careful navigating this space.  The doors opened to reveal a walking exhibit of the planning and aftermath of the bus boycott.  The guide continued to walk among the exhibits and ushered us through them.  When we got to the end of the walk, double doors featured an audio recording of a MLK sermon; at its end, visitors were invited to walk through them, simulating a church revival service.  The tour ended shortly thereafter.

I think the only thing I have to recommend is being told what else is in this building.  I suppose it worked out well since we had additional stops planned.  Nevertheless, I urge visitors to view other exhibits in the museum.  Of interest is a room showcasing the tattered clothing of enslaved Africans, their names tagged on the sleeves.

review.author: Shara W.
review.description: Loved it he is interactive tours. Felt like i was there back in time. Very educational!

review.author: Shannon J.
review.description: A beautifully crafted edifice in honor of our beloved she-roe-- Mrs. Parks that has a children's location right next to it!!!  Simply Lovely!!\n\nDonaldsonville. La

review.author: Amy S.
review.description: Not a clean environment for the children, there are mice in the building. The owner Vicki knows this, and still has not reported the issue. I know this firsthand, also the "teachers" love to take a nap with the children. I'm sorry, but when is it ever ok to nap when the kids are? Who is responsible when they get up and there is not an adult to watch them? I would not recommend the school to anyone.

name: Emory & Henry College Health Science Campus
Smyth County Education Ctr of Wthvlle Cmmnty Cllge

review.author: K O.
review.description: I am only giving this  4 out of 5 starts right now since my kids have been attending for just a month although I am happy with the place. (I will update my rating after school starts up again.)  So far I like that the kids can come at any time on any or all of the five days that it is open and can get one-on-one help with tutors for the entire 1 hour session if they want it.  I also like that at the end of each session a progress report for each kid is provided to the parent which tells what the kids worked on, what they have accomplished and what they need to work on.  The kids get instant rewards for completing session work to keep them motivated, and also earn "cards" they can save up and exchange for prizes in the future.\n\nThe facility is always clean and orderly, and the people who work there are friendly and helpful.  If you have more than one kid enrolled at a time there is a discount on the others.  The owner is very nice and works with the kids as well.

review.author: Linda C.
review.description: Mathnasium's individualized curriculum based on my children's assessment has help them set the foundation for strong math skills. We attend the math center 4 days a week and I think the consistency is also key to their success. My 8th and 5th grader really enjoy going to Mathnasium. My 8th grader in Algebra 1 says "tutors are great with helping her prepare for upcoming tests". My 5th grader improved his Maps math score by 10 points. Mathnasium is not just for those struggling in math but keeps them on track to success.

review.author: Corena E.
review.description: Family oriented, low turn over, teachers great kids as if they were their own. Great atmosphere and lots of learning.

review.author: Allison D.
review.description: My son and daughter both attended this school for several years, and my daughter continues to attend. We have had a very positive experience with LEMS. The teachers truly care and build a relationship with each child and family. The director is very flexible in regard to working with your schedule needs. I especially love the diversity of the students and teachers at the school and the focus on teaching kids about other countries and cultures.

review.author: Matt M.
review.description: After looking online for a place for my two little ones to attend daycare in the near future we were sold online from the security that was in place, curriculum that was taught, and all the smiling children. Therefore, my wife and I drove from another state to take a tour and were told by our daycare to do it unannounced to get a true feeling on how they interact with the kids and with you. We entered to building... Yes we entered the building and walked around for 15 minutes looking (without a code) and did not run into a singleness member. This should have been our first warning to run but I gave them the benefit and tracked down a worker due to no staff being in their offices either. The staff member said they were celebrating a event and said tonsit and wait and the director would come out and speak with us. So we waited for 15 minutes and subsequently I went and tracked down another staff member and asked if the director had time for us today. Finally the director came out of a room and seemed irritated to even speak with us. She said no tours could be given today. I asked if we could come back later in day to do a tour and her response was no I have to pick my kids up at 3. I then asked her if anyone else was available to give a tour and her response was no. After this attempt my wife and I left. Please don't bring your kids to this daycare due to safety concerns with anybody being able to walk in /out unannounced and the unpleasant staff that could possibly take care of your kids.

review.author: Poonam S.
review.description:
this is review for Little Einstein, Bentonville AR.

Pros first:  My child's first school and he never cried, always happy to go, he had great teachers in Junior preschool, though he was in the process of potty training the teachers accepted him without pull ups ( which is just wonderful), as usually schools would prefer pull ups till child is not fully trained.


Now the cons: it doesnt have any streamlined curriculum that is followed but each week is dedicated to a particular theme and activities are developed around it.  
During December 2013, after my son spent like nearly 4 months in junior preschool,  the school reshuffled its classes and surprisingly my child was pushed from Junior preschool ( 2- 3 years ) to early preschool (19- 30 months) though he was just 3 weeks short of 30 months.  There wasnt any  prior intimation, nor were parents concerns invited. I mean how can you demote a child to a lower school program, there is definitely some big difference between the two levels.   I observed that the children in early preschool were mostly exposed to television and showed stuff like Curious George ... 

Though we have relocated and thankfully out of the class otherwise i would have to wait for my child to go to Junior again only if there was any vacancy again.  So weird !!!

The teachers, esp Ms Becky, junior preschool was great... however the school management is not very friendly.

review.author: CardsFan 1.
review.description: I was very disappointed in my experience with Little Einstein Montessori School in Bentonville. I will speak for the infant/toddler rooms only for this is where my child was at during his enrollment. There is high turnover with the teachers, inconsistent structure, sporadic or sometimes no updates on child throughout the day on the "daily connect app", dirty rooms, children sharing their belongings, etc. I had a Tylenol bottle come up empty after just buying it! Was this given to my child? Other children? Nobody seemed to know anything about it. My child came home with a huge scratch on his arm and there is still a scar from it. Again, none of the teachers knew what happened. I would not recommend this place for your child especially if you are like me and want to have good interactive relationships with your child's teachers and be informed about your child at all times.

review.author: Landon W.
review.description: DO NOT RECOMMEND!! Enrolled my son near May. It is currently the end of July when they unenrolled him. I had a meeting with the director due to billing. They could never pull the correct amount out and continued to pull over $500 bi-weekly. While I was having a meeting with the director, she continued to interrupt me and yelled at me. when I addressed her yelling at me, she said "it's because you're getting upset with me". I then set up a meeting with the owner of the Mustard Seed Location and the Ark location. During that meeting she could not explain where my money was going and why it was being pulled incorrectly. She then continued to say that my "money doesn't even pay the bills". Go to take my son in the next day after the meeting and was greeted with being told my son can not come in the building. Teachers are amazing! The staff is very irresponsible.

review.author: Dee R.
review.description: The school has a good philosophy and works to make quality choices for teachers.  They are responsive to our concerns and love the children.  The food served is pretty nutritious also.\nThe downside is there is a lot of turnover.  Their great teachers and staff are often picked up by the schools, or leave as result of normal turnover in the industry.\nI have never seen a problem with ratio.  Our son has attended the school from 5 months and he is now 3.

review.author: Tara V.
review.description: well they hire people who are good and some that are not good who either space out or yell at the children and tell them how bad they are sitting them in a timeout chair for over an hour. Teachers are overwhelmed and are over ratio unless DHS comes in then they make themselves look good. This place is very sad and they do not care about the teachers and only some of the children.

review.author: Spencer F.
review.description:
Caution: this place is a deposit mill. By all means, putting a deposit down should not mean that your child is guaranteed attendance at any day care...unless you are lead to believe so by their staff. 

I put a deposit down nearly a year ago following voluntary assurance from the team that it would be no problem to get our child in before my wife was planning to go back to work. 

Following this, we never once received any follow up, any indication of a broad timeframe of when our child could start, or even an idea of where our child is on the waiting. 

We've had much better luck at many of the other local daycares.

review.author: Courtney M.
review.description:
We are SO happy here!

Both of my boys attend here, one in the infant/toddler program and one in the Pre-K. We have been so thrilled with the quality of care our boys receive. They love being dropped off and I love that I get updates all day on their routines and learning via the ap. The transparency is wonderful for peace of mind. 

My children are learning so much and thriving. They are loved on and cared for and happy! I would (and do) recommend this school to anyone looking. 

I also love that with my older sons food allergies they are so aware (everyone from kitchen to directors to floating help) that I never have to worry - they treat him as if he is their own and make all accommodations. 

Being away from them is hard enough so knowing that they are safe, healthy, happy and enjoying their day is so wonderful!

review.author: LaDonna F.
review.description: I work at Cadence of Rogers and have for 4 years, I love our school, parents and children. I couldn't see myself any other place.

review.author: Madeleine S.
review.description: This is my favorite school in Rogers. I teach extra curricular activities all around Washington and Benton county, so I see how all the preschools are ran. The teachers and front office staff are the friendliest you can find, and the teachers are all extremely kind and attentive. The kids are happy, the facility is clean. It's really the best! If I had preschool age kids, they would be at Cadence in Rogers.

review.author: Deb B.
review.description: As I continue to get pictures and updates through the day it just brings a smile to my face and I feel like I have to write a review to let others know about Cadence as well.  First off, yes I will agree with Rachel J's review below about the previous asst director, however since we started she left about a month after and things couldn't be any better!  I get updates on my little girl throughout the day and pictures as well!  I love all the art projects they do with the little ones and book reading, exploring, playing outdoors, etc.... No matter how young, they have a curriculum planned daily for your little one.  I don't feel like I could even come close to matching all the fun things they do here with my little one.  It seems like she comes home weekly learning and saying something new.  I just love it!  And the teachers and staff here are OUTSTANDING!  You can tell they genuinely care for your child and not sure how, but everyone knows her by name, office staff and other teachers she's never had.  \n\nI will add, no one paid me to write this, just an honest review because I know how hard it is to find GREAT childcare.  I think I toured over half of them in the area and if it's not the BEST then it's not for my little one.  Thanks Cadence staff for being so great!!

review.author: Shanah C.
review.description: I highly recommend Cadence, I have two kids at this school.  The Director, Twila, is very open and listens and treats my kids with so much love!  The teachers are wonderful and in comparison to other schools it seems like there is minimal turnover with the lead teachers.

review.author: Chastity M.
review.description: My son has been here for a year and we LOVE it!!!! Can't speak highly enough of the teachers!!

review.author: Danielle L.
review.description:
My twins started at Cadence Academy on opening day and we have been impressed from the start! From the moment we walked in, we felt the warmth, care, and professionalism that encompass the entire center. Annalyn, the director has done a wonderful job getting to know all the students and families and making us all feel welcome and part of the Cadence family. Any questions or concerns I've had have been immediately answered or addressed. 
All of the teachers have great attitudes and genuinely care about their students. They provide plenty of one on one time throughout the day, and even extra TLC when needed. Miss Abbie, the lead infant teacher does a fantastic job and is passionate about her babies. She has worked with my twins through several transitions already and continues to teach them new skills everyday. We would love for her to move to toddlers with them!

Overall, Cadence Academy is a top notch school in Rogers and comes highly recommended. I don't know how anyone could have anything negative to say about this school and the staff!

review.author: Samantha D.
review.description: Our family has nothing but good things to say about Cadence Academy! The staff is there because they truly love and care for children - this is not "just a job" to any of them and it undoubtedly shows! The curriculum is amazing, facility is safe and spotless, and the staff - especially the Director - are all approachable and easy to talk to. This is where you want your child(ren)!

review.author: Amy D.
review.description: ALWAYS ask about teacher turnover rates. In the time my child attended, more that 6 teachers were hired and left. (In 6 mo.)  Turnover rates in daycare can be an issue. In this case, it was ridiculous. The blame for that should be directly placed on the director. As an educator myself, I say run, don't walk away from this place!!!

review.author: Maggi M.
review.description: I can't express how grateful I am to the director Whitney for always making the time to answer any questions or concerns we have regarding our son Nodin. Nodin has been with this location for about 4 months now. He's 2 1/2 and an only child. We moved here from Denver in August and it hasn't been the easiest transition for him. Enrolling him at La petite Bentonville Ar. has been the one of the best choices as parents we've made. We recently started potty training and genuinely had no idea how much work time and stress can accompany that life change. Our son who has always slept through the night started getting up multiple times each night as he curiously wanting to grasp this new toilet concept. I more often than not drop him off at La Petite Academy after having had almost no sleep  and every morning Whitney and I go over his progress and she gives suggestions and tips I would not know otherwise. She is completely dedicated to every child in the building and having someone to answer my questions, tactically make me aware of potential mistakes, while still making me feel validated as a mother has truly been a blessing. I trust her and the staff completely while my son is i their care  and to me that's priceless.

review.author: Kasey L.
review.description: I love this daycare/academy! My son is always coming home with new things to share!! The teachers are great with them. I also love that they have a speech therapist there so that I don't have to leave work to take him to his appointments, they do them right there!! If you want a choold care that will provide for your child, I would totally recommend this place!

review.author: Celeste C.
review.description: Your child will be safe here. They are careful and \nsend lots of daily reports. The child to caretaker ratio is too high, however. I believe they need more teacher/caretakers per child.

review.author: Jennifer T.
review.description: My 2 year old daughter loves going to school every day. This is her first daycare and at first she had a really hard time at drop off, but they are really good with her and it's getting better and better every day. She has SO much fun when she gets there and they send updates and pictures throughout the day. Everyone knows her name and she is well loved. The director is outstanding. Whitney knows each child by name and obviously loves them and her job. Her educational background ensures that they are learning age appropriate skills and having fun doing it. I couldn't have asked for a better place to put my precious daughter.

review.author: Elizabeth S.
review.description: La Petite is wonderful with our son that was diagnosed with autism 2 years ago.  They allow the ABA therapists from Thrive and the OT and SLT therapy teams to work at the school.  The director and teachers really work together with the therapists to help our son get ready for kindergarten.  Joe was not speaking many words when he started, and his language has increased and his skills have improved where he can attend a general education classroom next year.  La Petite is truly a safe, fun, educational, and perfect place for our son to learn and make friends. I don't know where we would be without them, and they have changed our lives for the better in our family.  Thank you so much!

review.author: Sally L.
review.description: What a fantastic place for children!  My pre-school grandson came to visit during a week when I had to work and I decided it was time for him to try a daycare setting to prepare for Kindergarten.  I met with La Petite Director Misty Hopkins and after an excellent discussion little Ivan was ready to start the next business day.  After his week he said he made LOTS of friends.  Overall he had a really wonderful experience and now he's better prepared to start school next month.  Thanks Misty and all the ladies at La Petite!

review.author: Jimmy S.
review.description: Great place great Quality care for your family all the staff are great nothing bad to say about it you can leave your children there and feel great about it love this place

review.author: Phillip G.
review.description: They're in the business of taking enrollment fees when they knowingly don't have space to take on more children. They're essentially selling a product they don't have. Granted the place must be good if they're always full, but they completely lack integrity when it comes to getting new families to sign up. We paid the $100 registration fee and were told that they would have an opening in a few months. We've waited for more than a year and still haven't gotten in. I tried to work with them on getting my money back before posting anything, but it doesn't matter that they blatantly sold me on something they don't have. The only thing that matters to them is the contract I had signed which protects them from their dishonesty.

review.author: Stephanie F.
review.description: Well worth the wait. My daughter is absolutely thriving and loves going to "school". She eats a variety of healthy foods for breakfast, snack and lunch everyday (and I don't have to do a thing). The staff put the children first always. We toured several places and this one definitely stood out above the rest.

review.author: Michael W.
review.description:
There are so few alternative educational options in Bentonville. There are plenty of private schools, but very few that are not parochial. More importantly, very few who are as tolerant, inclusive, and focused on raising children to honor peace and civility and to appreciate the natural world around them.

Montessori is not daycare. It is not even your traditional school. Children at Walnut Farm are empowered to do things for themselves, and to study that which interests them most. In addition to several well appointed Montessori classrooms they also have a few unique features such as an outdoor classroom where children are learning life skills including gardening and caring for animals. The school also has a natural playground with features literally carved from the forested hillside.

I see my little boy growing into a confident, warm, caring, and intelligent young man at Walnut Farm. He loves to read and do math. He is fascinated by and in love with every kind of animal. He loves his teachers and his classmates. 

When kids reach school age, we rely on the school to mold them into the people we want them to be. Schools have the kids from 8 to 3 most days, leaving just 4 or 5 hours with their parents. If they are going to play that big a role in the development of my child... then I feel strongly about choosing a school that not only does a good job educating my child, but also teaches him to grow up tolerant of the many differences in people around the world. 

They take children from toddlers through around the equivalent of 6th grade.

review.author: Max B.
review.description: I'm a parent with a son at Walnut Farm for almost two years.  He loves going here and is excited every day.  My wife and I are amazed at the progress he's making and are impressed with the teaching and administrative staff.  I'm a strong advocate of the Montessori method and Walnut Farm has been at it for a long time... they know what they're doing.  When we meet former students or even older kids at the school now, we're so impressed with their maturity, awareness and capabilities.

review.author: Nene W.
review.description: We moved from California over a year ago. My daughter has been attending Walnut Farm as a preschooler for the present school year. We absolutely love the school and it's staff. The teachers are truly special and amazing! They are witty, kind, knowledgable,compassionate, creative, and have such a wealth of experience. We have a lot of experience with having been through 6 preschools between both of my kids. We love the involvement with nature and the lack of electronics in the school. My daughter learned to read in the past year, and her confidence is amazing. She has also learned great conflict resolution skills (communication) and real life skills (ex: setting/clearing the table). This school has a great peaceful & positive enviornment  that is very welcoming. I am so grateful that they are here!

review.author: Terri W.
review.description:
My family wanted to find an educational alternative for our son that was more than just a school. We wanted a place where the person he is going to be can be nurtured. We wanted a place where his natural curiosity can be fostered. We wanted a place where tolerance, acceptance, and peace are just a natural part of the day. 

Not only is he receiving core curriculum (reading, writing, math, science), but he is exposed to rich extras such as Spanish, nature education, life skills, art, and music. Children learn to investigate and research from a very young age. The learning is sparked by interest - so the child is more invested in it. 

The Montessori method truly is remarkable and Walnut Farm does a lovely job of presenting an authentic experience. The classrooms - both indoor and outdoor - are led by caring, passionate teachers where the students are encouraged to engage with the lessons. They are empowered to learn and given the necessary tools to do so.

If you have a child between 18 months and 12 years and want more than just a traditional education, consider a visit to Walnut Farm. It is my greatest hope that you see what my family saw the very first time we set foot on the campus.

review.author: Charlie Ann H.
review.description: I have one child at this school and will be enrolling our youngest soon.  I love the school and their curriculum.  It really gives the children freedom to explore what interests them and therefore stretches their attention and learning.  They have an outdoor classroom with a teacher outside at all times for instruction.  I think that is amazing!  There are two trained teachers in each room.  They offer Spanish, art, and life skills along with your typical school subjects.  We are very happy with the school and so is our child.

review.author: Jimmy S.
review.description: Great place great Quality care for your family all the staff are great nothing bad to say about it you can leave your children there and feel great about it love this place

review.author: Phillip G.
review.description: They're in the business of taking enrollment fees when they knowingly don't have space to take on more children. They're essentially selling a product they don't have. Granted the place must be good if they're always full, but they completely lack integrity when it comes to getting new families to sign up. We paid the $100 registration fee and were told that they would have an opening in a few months. We've waited for more than a year and still haven't gotten in. I tried to work with them on getting my money back before posting anything, but it doesn't matter that they blatantly sold me on something they don't have. The only thing that matters to them is the contract I had signed which protects them from their dishonesty.

review.author: Stephanie F.
review.description: Well worth the wait. My daughter is absolutely thriving and loves going to "school". She eats a variety of healthy foods for breakfast, snack and lunch everyday (and I don't have to do a thing). The staff put the children first always. We toured several places and this one definitely stood out above the rest.

name: Institute of Music Worship & the Arts

review.author: Susan S.
review.description: I attempted to get lessons for my nephew and the woman couldn't get any information correct. She called me and my sister several times for the same information. She sounds very old and not sure if she should be giving lessons anymore if she can't even get simple information correct. We will not be going with them.

review.author: James M.
review.description: If you want a good education and you want it cheap then CCRI is the place to be. Great math department and Allied Health has a lot of programs here. Go on Rate my professor because they are usually pretty accurate and use the recourses because the library is great and as a student you get free printing and the campus security is great and they have a pool in Lincoln and a gym at Lincoln and at Warwick.

review.author: Bisan K.
review.description: The food at the cafeteria is amazing. There are some really good professors and the education is affordable and free for some. They have a really big soccer field and a really good swimming pool.

review.author: Holly S.
review.description: CCRI is hands down, the best deal in the state. With four campuses, a satellite location in Westerly and online classes as well as classes held from 7 am until 7 pm and weekends, there's a time and convenient place for everyone. Faculty here focus on teaching and the classes are small which means faculty know their students. In today's economy, a degree is a must!

review.author: William K.
review.description: CCRI Flanagan Campus.  I love CCRI, it's a great place to start your secondary education.  I haven't had any bad experiences.  The faculty is helpful and friendly.  The classes are fun and educational.

review.author: E S.
review.description:
I'll apologize ahead of time for my lengthy review; however, I feel it's necessary to provide in depth details of my negative experience with hopes it could possibly help another family considering using this company for their infant care needs. 

I'll start off by offering some general advice for any potential customer considering using  Virginia is for Doulas. First and foremost, I would most definitely consider getting a written description of what a doula can or cannot do. The scope of my needs stayed relatively constant over a period of a few months. Unfortunately, Tiffany (the owner) changed her mind several times as to what her doulas could or could not do and as a result, we had to look for help elsewhere at the last minute. As mentioned, this changed several times based on Tiffany changing her mind alone.  

Secondly, a written copy of their sick policy is a must. Decide on whether you want your infant/child exposed to a sick doula. In our particular case, our son is a preemie. We verbally requested that any sick doulas should stay home to avoid any issues for our son and his weakened immune system. Our doula was sick and our pediatrician recommended that she not return to work until 48 hours had passed after starting antibiotics. Tiffany still charged us for those particular days of our doula being sick. Even after, our doulas health continued to decline and she had to miss work for almost a week. Clearly it was a terrible idea for her to work due to her own sickness, let alone work around an infant with a weakened immune system to begin with. As a result, our entire family got sick that ended in multiple doctor visits and medications just from being exposed to our sick doula.  

Another clarification that is extremely important is what happens when your doula can't come into work. Not only limited to being sick but for any reason they can't make it to work. On multiple occasions my family was left in a predicament where fill-in support was not provided. There were several instances where we never even received a text, phone call or email from Tiffany or anyone for that matter about the status of finding a replacement. We had to sign up with a completely different agency that could provide back-up help for our family at the last minute.  

Aside from all the frustrations listed above, the lack of professionalism on Tiffany's part was the most unsettling of all. I'm a fairly open-minded person. I realize mistakes happen. No one is perfect. However, I wasn't expecting Tiffany's unprofessionalism with regards to my genuine concerns. I was caught off guard by her rudeness and condescending attitude as if I had no reason to be upset. In many responses from Tiffany directly, it was almost as if I was being blamed or at fault for how those given situations were handled and I was offended. Both my husband and I have 25+ years of consulting experience with a strong background in client management and customer service. Tiffany could benefit from improving the way she handles interpersonal communication with her long-term clients. While she was cordial and pleasant for the first few months, over time her attitude went from pleasant to disrespectful and ill-mannered in all forms of communication. Not something you'd expect from the owner of the company. Her behavior and way of handling certain situations caused me to want to cut ties with her on many occasions, but I remained a long-term client because of one particular doula named Summer. 

We adored Summer because of her compassion, her knowledge and her love for what she does and for all the babies she cares for. Had it not been for Summer, we wouldn't have remained clients for as long as we did. 

I'm hoping this review will help anyone who reads it and is considering going the route of hiring a doula and using this particular company. I'm simply being honest about my family's personal experience and I genuinely wouldn't want anyone else to be put in some of the situations we were or be spoken to in the manner that we did.

review.author: Crsl C.
review.description: If you're pregnant and in the market for a doula for your upcoming delivery, I highly recommend Virginia is for Doulas. Tiffany and her team are extremely knowledgable and were helpful and supportive during my entire pregnancy through the delivery and post partum. I researched and considered other doulas in the area, but booked them after my initial phone consult because Tiffany was so friendly and informed, I knew I'd be in good hands. I ended up having an emergency early induction and was so glad to have Tiffany as my doula providing pain relief and support during what could have been a scary delivery - thanks to her help, my baby was born smoothly and I recovered faster than I did with my first child.\n\nThe package we chose also included birth photography and follow up birth announcement photo shoot; other doulas try to double as birth photographer but I'm glad they provided a separate photographer so the doula can focus without having to multitask. My photos came out beautifully and I'm glad we'll always have them to remember this special time. My husband and I also attended the birth expo they hosted which was informative and full of freebies. If we have another baby, I will definitely book them again in the future! Thank you Tiffany!

review.author: erin k.
review.description: I delivered with VIFD in April and had an outstanding experience. Kara and Tiffany were my doula teammates, and I had the great fortune that both of them were able to attend the birth. I had been fairly apprehensive about being able to VBAC but with the support of my team I did it, with a 8 lb baby, no less. Having the kind of triumphant birth I did made for a much better transition to new motherhood than with my first (emergency c-section). Our family is complete but if I were pregnant again I would hire the VIFD team again in a heartbeat.

review.author: Erin K.
review.description: Tiffany and the whole team at Virginia is for doulas were wonderful to deal with.  They helped us with postpartum care for our newborn twins many nights a week when I only got a few weeks off work.  I highly suggest them, especially for parents of multiples.  I have NO IDEA what we would have done without them!  Professional, well-run business with compassionate staff we felt very comfortable having in our home.  The added bonus of lactation help if you run into issues.  They came highly recommend to us.

review.author: Sarah A.
review.description: I found Virginia is for Doulas after Googling, and wanting an unmedicated birth knew this was the way to go! Heather and Jessica provided great info during the pregnancy and we enjoyed getting to know them. Long store short, my water started leaking at 35 weeks and I was induced. Heather was on call and was there for most of my labor. I ended up with an epidural - had I known this up front we would never have hired a doula service but realize now how nice it was having Heather there. She was able to provide lots of information, but also was another friend in the room. The whole process with Virginia is for Doulas was amazing - I would highly recommend them to anyone!

review.author: Madison M.
review.description: i would make it a 0 but that is not possible so i gave a 1. anyways you get int ruble for things that you dot do? and for the making fun of the lgbtq+  that was not my friend group. and this school needs a attitude adjustment. and the teachers don't teach all they do is sit in the front of the class like you went to collage to teach like do it.

name: Home Service of Clarke County Parenting Education Center
Home Service Of Clarke County Parenting Education Center

review.author: Zoe H.
review.description: Amazing staff, wonderful facility. Always going above and beyond for the children. The director is truly a blessing.

review.author: Sarah B.
review.description: Briarwood Child Academy is an exceptional daycare!! The teachers go through trainings yearly and all seem to love what they do! They are always smiling and very welcoming and take great care of the kids. For infants and toddlers, they use an app called Daily Connect so I can see what is going on with my child in real time and I can also communicate with the teachers on it.  I feel at peace dropping my child off here!

review.author: Meredyth W.
review.description:
I cannot say enough about what a great place Briarwood was for our kids.   The teachers, the director, and all the staff are kind, loving, patient, skilled, creative and super-accommodating. We had a previous daycare that treated our daughter very poorly, and the result was she was untrusting of teachers and acting out. When I came to Briarwood, I had a long talk about her situation with Miss Kelly, the director, and instantly knew that things would be much better here. Her teacher at Briarwood was so loving and gentle that she won her over right away, and turned her whole life around. (Wonderful Miss Ashley, who has since gone back to teaching elementary school.) Our daughter went from a kid who hated school and didn't trust authority to one who is a cooperative, eager learner who looks forward to school and loves her teachers.  Our son was struggling with potty training at home, but when he moved into preschool, Miss Kayla expertly got him going right away, and acted as if it were no work at all! Her art projects are unbelievable, too. Our son just loved her! Both my kids LOVED the monthly, themes learning in depth about a different country, an author, a musician and an artist each month. My 3-year-old is still obsessed with Zimbabwe and wants to visit it. The teachers all were great, and they maintain a good balance of free play, structured activity and academics for each age level. 

Among the many things I love about Briarwood is that they are fantastic and efficient with communication. The kids' art and work came home daily along with plenty of info about what they were working on. Monthly newsletters, email weekly or whenever anything came up. And they make things easy on parents -- you can sign up to have your tuition paid by EFT, so there's no remembering checks every week. Before COVID, lunch and snacks were even included! Never any hassles about when you needed to pick up a kid early or drop off late. I've used daycares that act as though you are lucky they let you use their services, and you'd better adjust to their rules or you can take your business elsewhere. Briarwood isn't like that; they understand that working parents need flexibility, and they handle everything that comes up with grace and kindness. This is not a place where you will be bombarded with notes about every negative thing your kid may have done through the day. They'll tell you what you need to know, but they also understand that kids are developing people, and they are your partner in helping them develop.

The facility is awesome. They have an indoor gym (called the gross motor room, and it still makes me laugh to hear my kids say that), TONS of room and large, airy classrooms that are well-lit, well-maintained and stocked with great stuff. In the summer, the waterplay areas are top-notch. The playgrounds are good, too. 

I would also say the teachers here are more experienced, have less turnover and are just overall much happier than at the other daycares we're been in. It makes a big difference when the staff is happy. The environment is relaxed, peaceful and conducive to learning, and the kids are more comfortable and happier. 

I am not exaggerating when I say that our experience at Briarwood changed our whole family's life. They gave our kids the love and understanding they'd been missing at their previous daycare, as well as a calmer, more supportive atmosphere. They replaced the constant anxiety we felt with our previous daycare with a sense of peace, since we knew our kids were being treated well and were learning and developing. 

We left only because we don't live in North Smithfield, and when our daughter started kindergarten, there was no transportation from her school two towns away. It broke our hearts, because we just loved everything about Briarwood. We all miss it!

review.author: William C.
review.description: Our toddler has been enrolled part time for three months now and loves it. The facility is large, including an indoor gym play area as well as a nice outdoor playground. The classrooms are roomy and well organized. They have toddler-sized toilets and lowered sinks to make teaching hygiene skill easier. Each student has a cubby in the hallway for their jackets and change of clothes as well as a folder in their classroom that will contain their art projects or communications from the staff. The teachers are so friendly and clearly enjoy working with kids. They serve meals from the restaurant next door but are also happy to give them any food you send from home instead. There is a free online service they use to provide updates throughout the day which usually describe when they were changed, when they ate, how much, and sometimes even pictures or a short description of their day. They are also active on Facebook with general news and pictures that help parents feel more connected. The director recently changed from Kim to Kelly, and I'm not sure if that impacts some of the older negative reviews on here. Kelly and another gentlemen run this daycare and seem to be very organized, communicative (via email usually weekly), and flexible. At this time I don't have anything negative to say about the facility or staff at Briarwood and would wholeheartedly recommend enrolling your toddler here.

review.author: Andrea V.
review.description: SMOKE AND MIRRORS DAYCARE; \nTerrible daycare! The only thing that this place has going for it, is the splash pad in the back and the gross motor skills room for the kids. My son was there from three months to three years old, so I didn't feel comfortable pulling him since that's all he knew, Fortunately at one point we couldn't afford it and had to pull him and it was the best thing we did. The girls there have absolutely no training with children, except for the head teacher, which they are barely with. Towards the end of his last year, They put him on a three strike policy, multiple times. On the third strike he would be kicked out. Since I had no back up plan and I am a full time working mom,  I did anything I could to keep him there. Which meant sending him to the Providence Center, and I knew in my heart, was not right for him. Those children that attend there have deep emotional issues; which my son is just a typical three-year-old who is a little rambunctious and needed more one-on-one attention and redirection. Long story short the girls there have zero training with children and should be in no means in charge of these kids, their prices are totally outrageous , you are pretty much paying high school/college girls to watch your children during the day with no training. Last but not least, the daycare was not clean, it would smell of dirty diapers every time I would pick up my son up at the  end of the day, I never saw them wiping down the tables or the  toys. Wait no, I take that back,there were a couple of times my son came home with bleach stains on his clothing. So I'm assuming they were cleaning the rooms down b4 the kids were picked up and not keeping them away from the chemicals afterwards. Not to mention my son was sick multiple, multiple times while he was there. One time he had to be hospitalized. Needless to say, he is now attending a great daycare in the woonsocket area and is doing GREAT! The teachers there couldn't understand why he was sent to the Providence Center.They enjoy his company and said his behavior is nothing but a typical 3 year old who just needs a little redirecting from TRAINED staff! I am a first time mom, so all this was new to me and I thought was normal for a daycare facility this large. I wish I knew what I know now, I would have never allowed him to attend there, let alone let them take  thousands of dollars of my hard earned money! PARENTS BEWARE!

review.author: Zac S.
review.description:
Briarwood Child Academy is an institution that is currently setting the standard in childcare and consistently looking to improve their quality of service by remaining up to date with the latest methods of teaching and caring for children as well as ensuring that they are up to date with the latest daycare technologies.

I have a child that attends full time and one that attends their afterschool program. Both are bringing home projects, artwork, and telling me about what they've learned that day whether it be about a new country, the weather, or (as was the case yesterday) how they learned to make a party hat. I've picked my kids up, (who are 3 and 6) and in the car they discussed foods they've cooked, foreign language words they've learned, and how much fun they had playing games outside as a group.

The staff is dedicated to the well-being of the children and they keep the parents informed regarding even the slightest of issues. For example, my daughter ran into another kid, it happens (she's 3). There was no bruise or cut yet the teacher as well as staff member informed me of the incident. They didn't have to as I would have never known, but it again reaffirmed the notion that they will do what is right over what is easy.

As a father and Veteran I am protective of my family and I trust this company with the care of my two children. Their professionalism as well as 'family oriented' atmosphere can be clearly seen through the many activities put on by the company such as Halloween party and charity events along with the mental growth the children experience. 

At the end of the day it comes down to two things for me in regards to the quality of the daycare my children are attending:

1) I feel that my children are safe and in a controlled environment.

2) That my children are better prepared for entering their next grade level in school.

Briarwood Child Academy is consistently setting the mark in both of these regards and therefore I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a place to send their kids.

review.author: Erin R.
review.description: Our son has gone to Briarwood since he was 3 months old. He is now in pre-school and has excelled in so many areas. He is going to be more than prepared for kindergarten and it is because the friendly and dedicated staff that has worked with my son every step of the way. I receive progress reports which I love, because I know exactly what milestones my son should be hitting and if he is. Their daily connect gives you such a peace of mind for the infants and toddlers because you can go on and check to see what your child is doing throughout the day. And I can not say it enough the staff is INCREDIBLE. They have loved my son  like he is their own. I would 100% recommend this daycare for your little one.

review.author: Jennifer D.
review.description:
Briarwood has been a godsend to this single mom who works a full time job. They are fully accredited and provide nutritionally balanced breakfasts, snacks, & lunches, for a very reasonable price when you shop around. 

I have 2 kids, one started in the infants room and has moved up to toddler. My oldest started in preschool and now is in the after school program.  All of my experiences have met or exceeded expectations. 

They have a solid leadership group that is committed to providing more than just a babysitting service. There is an educational curriculum at all age groups, and extracurricular activities including music class, sport camps, computer time, culinary skills, a large indoor gross motor room, a splash park outside, and use of the Wide World of Indoor Sports during the long cold winters. 

They have a nurse on staff who visits both campuses, and the staff is very communicative about any of those unavoidable outbreaks of common kid illnesses.
